content:
#25050 Adds the equivalence between Vector and List.Vector. @Eric Wieser and @Mario Carneiro reviewing.

I do have one immediate extra question: where do we put theorems about Vector in Mathlib? (NOT List.Vector). Data/Vector/* is theorems and definitions about List.Vector. Arguably possibly these should move to Data/List/Vector/*?
That move makes sense to me, but I wouldn't do it in the same PR
Would the theorems you have in mind fit in batteries?
Hmm, interesting question. One of those I was thinking of was the equivalence between Vector and Fin n - I think equivalences are a Mathlib thing?
But I was also thinking we could add in Vector.cons given it is currently absent.
equivFn indeed sounds like it belongs in mathlib
I guess for all the collection types with ofFn
Aye. It does sort of feel like one could imagine some kind of class which covers all of them though I'm not sure what it would look like?
But you see what I mean? ListLike or whatever.
I guess the distinction is between ones with a fixed length and ones without...

Anyway, regarding #25050, I've just pushed a commit which moves the actual equivalence to the same file as arrayEquivList as that seemed the right place to put it (I've also slightly edited that equivalence so it uses List.toArray instead of Array.mk, as I believe that is preferred.)
It isn't quite a subtypeEquiv, but it would be if Vector was implemented as a subtype (List.Vector is, Vector isn't).
How do I set this back to awaiting review?
You remove the awaiting-author tag, the absence of it implies that review is awaited
Oh... weird. I swear I couldn't edit tags before. Doy.
